title: China’s Trade Surplus Climbs Past $1 Trillion for First Time
summary: President Trump’s tariffs weren’t enough to hold back the global export flood by China, which pushed past last year’s record in just 11 months.

title: China’s Weak Currency Is Powering Its Exports and Drawing Criticism
summary: China’s renminbi is lagging the currencies of key trading partners, making Chinese goods and services cheap and helping to drive exports.

title: A Major Test of Presidential Power, and How States Make Billions From Online Casinos
summary: Plus, the social changes sweeping Iran.

title: A Weakened Hamas Still Dominates Gaza, Building Day by Day
summary: A cease-fire after two years of war with Israel has allowed Hamas to tighten its grip on power again. “It’s still standing,” one Israeli official said.

title: Syrians Celebrate Anniversary of Bashar al-Assad’s Fall
summary: A year ago, rebels overthrew President Bashar al-Assad, ending decades of dictatorship and civil war. But challenges remain for the new leadership.

title: The New Syria
summary: The country certainly still faces many challenges. But some things are now going right there — and those are worth our attention, too.

title: Powell Faces Pressure From Multiple Fronts as Fed Prepares to Cut Rates
summary: The chair of the central bank is dealing with internal divisions while being besieged by President Trump and front-runners jockeying to replace him.

title: U.S. Deports Second Planeload of Iranians, Officials Say
summary: The plane, carrying about 50 Iranians and other deportees, took off from Arizona on Sunday, under a deal the Trump administration reached with Iran two months ago.

title: Trump Hosts the Kennedy Center Honors, Breaking Tradition
summary: Past presidents have attended the marquee event, but on Sunday Mr. Trump was the first to host it, putting his cultural takeover of Washington in sharp relief.

title: Must the Military Disobey Unlawful Orders? Pam Bondi Has Said Yes.
summary: As a lawyer for a conservative think tank, Ms. Bondi, now the attorney general, filed a Supreme Court brief last year saying service members who followed such orders were committing crimes.

title: Supreme Court to Hear Major Test of Trump’s Power to Fire Officials
summary: The court’s conservative majority has generally let President Trump remove leaders of independent agencies like the Federal Trade Commission, at least temporarily.

title: Thai Jets Bomb Cambodia as at Least 5 Die in New Wave of Fighting
summary: Each side accused the other of firing first. The hostilities came weeks after President Trump had cast himself as a peacemaker in the decades-old border dispute.

title: Zelensky to Meet With European Leaders as Ukraine Peace Talks Drag On
summary: Ukraine’s president was expected in London to discuss with the leaders of Britain, France and Germany ways of ending the conflict against Russia.

title: He Was a Russian Activist in Exile. His Own Wife Accused Him of Spying.
summary: Poland has charged a little-known Russian opposition figure with espionage and participating in a bomb plot. His friends are perplexed.

title: 4 Takeaways From The Times’s Examination of N.Y.C. Subway Collisions
summary: New York City train operators witness more people being struck by trains than drivers in any other American system. Afterward, many struggle to get the help they need.

title: New Orleans Restaurants Feel Squeezed as Border Patrol Sweeps In
summary: Ripple effects from a federal crackdown illustrate how heavily the city’s robust dining scene depends both directly and indirectly on immigrant workers.

title: Golden Globes to Announce 2026 Nominations
summary: Movies like “One Battle After Another” and “Hamnet” are considered strong contenders for the top awards, along with television shows like “The Pitt” and “The Studio.”

title: What Trump’s East Wing Demolition Says About Our Preoccupation With ‘Renovation’
summary: The gutting of the East Wing of the White House and our national preoccupation with “renovation.”

title: A Corruption Scandal in Ukraine
summary: We examine an investigation that is testing Volodymyr Zelensky’s government.

title: United Nations Cuts Its 2026 Emergency Aid Budget in Half
summary: Huge reductions in foreign aid by the United States and Europe have led the U.N.’s emergency relief coordinator to slash its fund-raising targets for next year.

title: Miami Hasn’t Had a Democratic Mayor in Almost 30 Years. Is That About to Change?
summary: Democrats see their voters energized in a county that President Trump won. Republicans fear the runoff could add to recent losses.

title: Obamacare Users Face Higher Deductibles, Higher Premiums
summary: People who have insurance under the Affordable Care Act are being asked to pay more for plans that will cover less of their care.

title: Dogs in Kimonos: Japan Reinvents a Children’s Holiday With Pets in Mind
summary: A traditional Japanese festival is being adapted for poodles and Pomeranians, amid a booming pet industry and a dearth of children.
